title: nbdev
text:
Developer Guide
If you are new to using nbdev here are some useful pointers to get you started.

Install nbdev in Development mode
# make sure nbdev package is installed in development mode
$ pip install -e .

# make changes under nbs/ directory
# ...

# compile to have changes apply to nbdev
$ nbdev_prepare

title: nbdev
text:
Usage

Installation
Install latest from the GitHub repository:
$ pip install git+https://github.com/prashanth/nbdev.git
or from conda
$ conda install -c prashanth nbdev
or from pypi
$ pip install nbdev


Documentation
Documentation can be found hosted on this GitHub repository’s pages. Additionally you can find package manager specific guidelines on conda and pypi respectively.

title: PJC-1
text:
Core Philosophy

Without spiritual discipline, learning Jyotish is difficult - understanding all charts (past, present, future) requires spiritual support
Parashara Jyotish is deeply connected to spirituality (Vishnu Purana, Rigveda)
Appreciation of Guru is the first and most important step

title: PJC-1
text:
Key Practices Introduced

1. Guru Vandana

Prayer/worship of the Guru (13 stanzas)
Done first thing after morning bath
Can be recited in one sitting as daily Guru prayer
Traditionally sung at initiations in the parampara



2. Pancha Devatas (Five Deities)
These represent the five tattvas and are worshipped in order:

Ganesha (Prithvi/Earth) - Must be worshipped first; sits in Muladhara chakra
Surya (Agni/Fire) - Establishes energy levels
Vishnu (Akasha/Space) - Grants purity and connection
Devi (Jala/Water) - Brings sustenance and empathy
Shiva (Vayu/Air) - Stops storms in life

Important: Any one of these five can lead to moksha if worshipped properly.

title: PJC-1
text:
Main Sadhanas for PJC Year 1

Ganesha Sadhana (Primary - 1 Year)
Setup: - Draw Swastika mandala with red powder/paste - Place Ganesha picture at eye level (looking slightly up = sattvic) - Light ghee lamp (represents your home - keep it clean and personal) - Face East or Northeast (or strongest direction in Ashtakavarga of Sun)
Mantra Selection: - Use one of 12 Ganesha names based on YOUR LAGNA (from Sri Narada’s list) - Example: Sagittarius Lagna = “Om Soham balachandraya svaha”
Practice: - Minimum: 108 times daily for 1 year - Rigorous: 15 malas daily (22 malas on Chaturthi) - Start on Chaturthi (Ganesha’s tithi) - Keep pen and paper near Ganesha during sadhana (use that pen for Jyotish notes later)
Purpose: Strengthens Lagna, Jupiter, and Mercury → supports learning and Guru-Shishya connection


Narasimha Sadhana (40 Days)
Preparation: 1. Recite Shanti Mantra (from Rigveda) 2. Bija Pranayama (10 times): done with Pranayama - Inhale: “Om” - Hold: “Hreem” - Exhale: “Shraum” - Use both nostrils
Main Mantra: check slide

1,008 times daily for 40 days
Start on Tuesday
Can continue after 40 days

Purpose: - Connected to Mangala (Mars) - gives strength (satva) - Removes the 6 Ripus (enemies): Moha, Kama, Lobha, Matsarya, Krodha, Mada - Purifies luminaries, nakshatras, and agni - Strengthens mind for learning negative karmas in Jyotish


Muladhara Chakra Sadhana (Optional but Recommended)

Light lamp with “Sri Ram Jai Ram Jai Jai Ram”
Drink sweet water (jaggery/brown sugar, NOT white sugar) with “Om Ramachandraya Namaha”
Narayana Kavacha procedure
Mantra: “Om Hreem Kshraum Hum Phat” - 108 times
40 days

Purpose: Cleanses first three chakras (Muladhara, Swadhisthana, Manipura) related to basic instincts and manifested universe

title: PJC-1
text:
Practical Guidelines
Mala/Rosary: - Rudraksha recommended for Ganesha - 54 beads preferred (108 also fine) - Don’t touch with index finger (tarjani) - Once dedicated to sadhana, don’t use for other purposes
Diet: Vegetarian recommended but not mandatory for these sadhanas
Timing: - Parampara Mantra (Hare Rama Krishna): First thing upon waking - Other sadhanas: After bath, in the morning
Direction: East or Northeast best (or use Ashtakavarga of Sun for personal direction)

title: PJC-1
text:
Lesson 3






CautionSummary of Lesson 3 Transcript






Opening & Structure

Started with Guru Mantra (Om Guruve Namaha) repeated 12 times
Course officially begins on Makara Sankranti (Sun entering Capricorn) on a Thursday - both auspicious for spiritual learning
Future webinars will be held Sundays at 11 AM CET during Guru Hora
Calendar will be shared for planning ahead



Course Logistics & Guidelines
Telegram Group Usage: - Follow the syllabus/modules systematically - Keep questions focused on current module being studied - Ask intentional, specific questions (not open-ended “tell us more”) - Telegram is just a tool - take your own notes as primary resource - Mentors monitor discussions and will intervene if needed
Learning Approach: - Self-paced online course with mentor support - Guruji’s teaching method: Start with the NAME → meaning → application - Not spoon-feeding - some questions left for self-research - Learn from each other’s questions and discussions
Materials: - Adobe Flash issue being resolved - patience requested - All webinars recorded on private YouTube channel (permanent access) - 2-year access to PJC Year 1 materials (extendable)


Main Teaching: What is Jyotish?
Jyotish = Study of 33 Devas (not just planets/signs)

1. Ashtavasu (8 Vassus/Lights)

Sun & Moon - Original light givers (luminaries)
5 Tatwa Planets - Give knowledge through their physical nature:

Mars (Agni) - Fire, energy, engineering
Mercury (Prithvi) - Earth, solid state
Jupiter (Akasha) - Space, magnetism, connection
Venus (Jala) - Water, liquid state
Saturn (Vayu) - Air, movement, breath, longevity

Nakshatras - Mental desires and emotional states



2. Dvadasha Adityas (12 Adityas)

The 12 months/signs representing all material resources
Sun’s movement creates 30-degree portions (rashis)
Each sign = time period + space
Vishnu Aditya youngest



3. Ekadasha Rudra (11 Rudras)

Address destruction energies in horoscope
10 hold prana (life force) in body
11th relates to individual soul (calculated from Atmakaraka)
Connected to Rudra Bhavas (houses that can end life)



4. Indra & Prajapati (2)

Prajapati = Lagna/1st house (our creation/birth)
Indra = 10th house (throne, control of senses, karma)




Key Concepts Clarified
Rashis vs Bhavas: - Rashis = Material resources, physical quantities (“heap”) - Bhavas = Our thoughts/perceptions about life aspects
Important Axes: - 1st-7th: Birth-Death, Me-Others (horizontal, eye-level) - 4th-10th: Midnight-Noon, Lowest-Highest point (vertical)
Three Material Worlds: - Bhuloka - Earth (where we are) - Bhuvarloka - Solar system (Sun, planets) - Svargaloka - Sky (nakshatras, constellations)

title: PJC-1
text:
Lesson 4






CautionSummary of Lesson 4: Panchanga (Five Limbs of Time)






Opening Context

This is part of the Aramba (preparatory) portion of PJC Year 1
Aramba introduces many concepts that students will revisit throughout the year
Focus is on understanding basic concepts before diving deeper



What is Panchanga?
Pancha = Five, Anga = Limbs
The five fundamental divisions of time that form the foundation of any horoscope. Panchanga must be examined before looking at planetary positions, as it shows the quality of time for that birth.

The Five Limbs:

Vara (Day) - Agni Tatva
Tithi (Lunar day) - Jala Tatva

Karana (Half-tithi) - Prithvi Tatva
Nakshatra (Lunar mansion) - Vayu Tatva
Yoga (Sun-Moon combination) - Akasha Tatva




Benefits of Learning Panchanga

Vara - Prolongs life
Tithi - Brings prosperity
Karana - Gives success in all tasks
Nakshatra - Removes sin
Yoga - Immunity from disease



1. VARA (The Day)
Connection: Agni (fire), energy levels, physical health
Calculation: Sunrise to next sunrise
Seven Varas: Ravivara (Sunday), Somavara (Monday), Mangalavara (Tuesday), Buddhavara (Wednesday), Guruvara (Thursday), Shukravara (Friday), Shanivara (Saturday)
Analysis: - Check Varesha (lord of the day) placement from Lagna - Also check Varesha placement from Surya
Example Given: Franklin D. Roosevelt - Born Monday (Varesha = Moon) - Moon in 10th house conjunct Mars - Moon has zero Digbala (directional strength) in 10th - Moon-Mars = Gandanta (fire-water conflict) - Moon in 6th from Sun (enemy position) - Result: Polio (health issues related to movement on 4th-10th axis)

Vara Chakra Concepts:

6th graha = enemy (Shatru)
8th graha = eclipse (Grahana) - blocks manifestation




2. TITHI (Lunar Day)
Connection: Jala Tatva, relationships, emotional content, interactions
Calculation: Sun-Moon relationship; 1 tithi = 12 degrees of zodiac
30 Tithis total: 15 in Krishna Paksha (waning), 15 in Shukla Paksha (waxing)
Eight Lords: Surya, Chandra, Mangala, Budha, Guru, Shukra, Shani, Rahu (Ketu has no lordship)
Analysis: Check Tithi lord placement from 4th house

Problematic Tithis:
Rikta Tithis (4th, 9th, 14th) - Most problematic: - Too much emotion, self-centered - Chaturthi - Ganesha (deity) - Navami - Durga (deity) - Chaturdashi - Shiva (deity)
Other Doshas: - Ekadashi (11th) - Addiction/anger issues (Mars/Agni) → fasting advised - Trayodashi (13th) - Wealth problems - Krishna Chaturdashi & Shukla Pratipada - Serious relationship issues (related to Soma’s sin with Tara)
Example Given: Marilyn Monroe - Tithi lord = Venus - Venus in 10th house in Aries (enemy sign) - Zero Digbala - Had relationships but they were problematic



3. DIG CHAKRA (Directional Strength)
Eight directions where grahas have full potential:

East (Indra) - Surya - Self-realization
Southeast (Agni) - Shukra - Details, art
South (Yama) - Mangala - Warrior energy
Southwest (Niriti) - Rahu - Chaos
West (Varuna) - Shani - Detachment
Northwest (Vayu) - Chandra - Movement
North (Kubera) - Budha - Wealth, profession
Northeast (Ishana) - Guru - Knowledge

Plus: Upward (Ketu/Ananta - Moksha), Downward (Lagna/Brahma - Rebirth)


4. KALA CHAKRA (Time/Blockage Wheel)
Shows which grahas block each direction:

Mangala blocks Shukra (Agni corner)
Guru blocks Mangala (Yama corner)
Budha blocks Rahu (Niriti corner)
Shukra blocks Shani (Varuna corner)
Chandra blocks Budha (Kubera corner)
Rahu blocks Guru (Ishana corner)
Ketu blocks Surya (Indra corner)

Key Point: These are pairs that create either debate (Sattvic) or war (Tamasic)



Important Reminders:

Panchanga is the first layer - more factors will be added
Cannot make final judgments from Panchanga alone
Must learn grahas, rashis, bhavas before complete analysis
Return to Aramba concepts throughout the year as understanding deepens

Would you like me to clarify any specific aspect of Panchanga?

title: PJC-1
text:
Lesson 5






CautionSummary of Lesson 5: Rashi Swarupa (Nature of Signs)






Opening Context & Housekeeping
Learning Process: - Jyotish learning is spiral - same topics revisited from different angles/levels - Currently using “microscope” approach (detailed) vs “telescope” (broad picture from Aramba) - Learning Jyotish is like performing Brahma Yagya - devas work on you as you learn - Don’t fear Panchanga doshas you discover - you’re only seeing small details, not full picture
Important Clarifications: - Do NOT worship Sanjay Rath or put his picture on altar - He is Shiksha Guru (5th house - teacher of subject) - NOT Diksha Guru (9th house - spiritual guide who takes responsibility for soul)



RASHI NAMES (Parashara-Specific)
Names that differ from popular usage: - Mesha (Aries) - Ram - Vrishabha/Vrisha (Taurus) - Bull - Mithuna (Gemini) - Couple - Karkata (Cancer) - Crab - Simha (Leo) - Lion - Kumari (Virgo) - Young virgin girl (not just Kanya) - Tula (Libra) - Scale/Balance - Ali (Scorpio) - NOT Vrishchika; means blessing, bridge, or exalted (refers to semen storage) - Dhanu (Sagittarius) - Bow/Archer - Makara/Nakra (Capricorn) - Reversal of hell (karma determines direction) - Kumbha (Aquarius) - Pot/Water bearer - Meena (Pisces) - Fish



BRAHMA DOSHA (Creation Flaw)
Key Principle: Rashis with unclear/multiple symbols carry Brahma Dosha

5 Rashis WITHOUT Dosha:
Clear, single-element symbols: 1. Mesha - Ram (clear) 2. Vrishabha - Bull (clear) 3. Karkata - Crab (clear) 4. Simha - Lion (clear) 5. Vrishchika/Ali - Scorpion (clear)


7 Rashis WITH Dosha:









Rashi
Planet Showing Dosha
Devata Angered
Nature of Dosha




Meena
Surya (Sun)
Agni
Fish cursed to never see sunlight; Remedy: Pranayama


Kumbha
Chandra (Moon)
Jala
Water gets spoiled/fermented in pot; emotions problematic


Makara
Guru (Jupiter)
Indra
Loss of senses/direction; alcohol issues


Dhanu
Budha (Mercury)
Vishnu
Battlefield; right vs wrong obsession; righteous anger


Tula
Mangala (Mars)
Skanda
War vs prosperity conflict; “all fair in love and war”


Kanya
Shani (Saturn)
Brahma
Purity vs impurity; obsession with cleanliness


Mithuna
Shukra (Venus)
Lakshmi
Boy + girl + club + instrument; dominant Bhuloka dosha; relationship/emotion issues



Usage: Check dosha planet in chart when analyzing that ascendant - may not be as helpful as expected




RASHI COLORS

Mesha - Blood red/royal red
Vrishabha - Milk white
Mithuna - Green (all shades)
Karkata - White with red tinge (light pink)
Simha - White with yellow tinge (off-white/sand)
Kanya - Gray (intestines; discernment)
Tula - Black
Vrishchika - Light yellow (brownish due to Ketu)
Dhanu - Dark yellow/turmeric/golden
Makara - Dark blue (industrial)
Kumbha - Purple (Rahu; fermentation/poison/medicine)
Meena - Light blue (sky blue)




BODY PARTS (Kalapurusha)
Natural zodiac = God’s body template: 1. Mesha - Head 2. Vrishabha - Face & neck 3. Mithuna - Arms & shoulders 4. Karkata - Chest, heart, breast 5. Simha - Stomach & liver 6. Kanya - Intestines, navel 7. Tula - Below navel, kidneys 8. Vrishchika - Genitalia (HORIZONTAL - Ketu reverses) 9. Dhanu - Thighs 10. Makara - Knees 11. Kumbha - Calves 12. Meena - Feet (HORIZONTAL - Ketu reverses)
Exception: Ketu-ruled parts are horizontal, not vertical



GUNA OF RASHIS (Two Systems)

System 1: By Creation/Mobility










Type
Rashis
Guna
Energy
Devata




Chara (Movable)
Mesha, Karkata, Tula, Makara
Rajas
Excess energy, pioneers, creative
Brahma


Sthira (Fixed)
Vrishabha, Simha, Vrishchika, Kumbha
Tamas
Inert, stable, sustaining
Rudra


Dwi (Dual)
Mithuna, Kanya, Dhanu, Meena
Sattva
Balanced between mobile & fixed
Vishnu





System 2: By Lordship
Rashi lord’s guna adds layer to rashi: - Sattva planets: Surya, Chandra, Guru - Rajas planets: Budha, Shukra - Tamas planets: Mangala, Shani
Example: Mesha = Chara (Rajas by creation) + Mars lord (Tamas) = High energy but can be lazy/uninformed
How to Read: Check which guna dominates based on lord’s strength in chart




MALE/FEMALE SIGNS

Krura (Cruel/Male) - ODD signs:
Mesha, Mithuna, Simha, Tula, Dhanu, Kumbha - Aggressive, assertive, extroverted, outspoken - Make own decisions, less likely to seek advice


Saumya (Gentle/Female) - EVEN signs:
Vrishabha, Karkata, Kanya, Vrishchika, Makara, Meena - Passive, introverted, sustaining - More likely to seek guidance/advice
For Child Gender (Saptamsha only): - Mithuna & Karkata SWAP - Kumbha & Meena SWAP




YUGA RASHIS (Dharma/Light Level)

Krita/Satya: Simha, Vrishchika, Kumbha, Vrishabha - Things come easily, 100% support
Treta: Mesha, Karkata, Tula, Makara - 75% support, some effort needed
Dwapara: Dhanu, Meena, Mithuna, Kanya - 50% support
Kali: (remaining context) - Least support

Usage: Shows how much support/ease person has in getting knowledge, solutions



PLANETARY CABINET (Lordship Logic)
From Sun & Moon (King & Queen): 1. Sun & Moon - Leo & Cancer (King & Queen’s quarters) 2. Budha - Gemini & Virgo (Prince/Princess - next to parents) 3. Shukra - Taurus & Libra (Court ladies) 4. Mangala - Aries & Scorpio (Guards/Knights; Scorpio also has spies via Ketu) 5. Guru - Sagittarius & Pisces (Advisors/Priests/Ministers) 6. Shani - Capricorn & Aquarius (Workers/Commoners/Labor)
Also shows: Speed of planets from Earth (geocentric view)



MEMORY AID: Hand Method
Fingers = 12 Rashis (4 fingers × 3 parts = 12)

Fingertips (top part) = Chara rashis (Mesha, Karkata, Tula, Makara) - Most mobile, doing karma
Middle sections = Sthira rashis (Vrishabha, Simha, Vrishchika, Kumbha) - Fixed, no free will
Base/Root = Dwi rashis (Mithuna, Kanya, Dhanu, Meena) - Most controlling lagnas!

Dual lagnas control through: - Budha lagnas (Mithuna/Kanya) - Control via information/details - Guru lagnas (Dhanu/Meena) - Control via knowledge/belief systems

Next Steps: This foundational knowledge will be layered with grahas (planets), bhavas (houses), and yogas in upcoming lessons.

Battlefield; right vs wrong obsession; righteous anger


Tula
Mangala (Mars)

War vs prosperity conflict; “all fair in love and war”

Purity vs impurity; obsession with cleanliness

Boy + girl + club + instrument; dominant Bhuloka dosha; relationship/emotion issues

title: PJC-1
text:
BODY PARTS (Kalapurusha)
Natural zodiac = God’s body template: 1. Mesha - Head 2. Vrishabha - Face & neck 3. Mithuna - Arms & shoulders 4. Karkata - Chest, heart, breast 5. Simha - Stomach & liver 6. Kanya - Intestines, navel 7. Tula - Below navel, kidneys 8. Vrishchika - Genitalia (HORIZONTAL - Ketu reverses) 9. Dhanu - Thighs 10. Makara - Knees 11. Kumbha - Calves 12. Meena - Feet (HORIZONTAL - Ketu reverses)
Exception: Ketu-ruled parts are horizontal, not vertical

text:

System 1: By Creation/Mobility

Inert, stable, sustaining

System 2: By Lordship
Rashi lord’s guna adds layer to rashi: - Sattva planets: Surya, Chandra, Guru - Rajas planets: Budha, Shukra - Tamas planets: Mangala, Shani
Example: Mesha = Chara (Rajas by creation) + Mars lord (Tamas) = High energy but can be lazy/uninformed
How to Read: Check which guna dominates based on lord’s strength in chart

title: PJC-1
text:
MALE/FEMALE SIGNS

Krura (Cruel/Male) - ODD signs:
Mesha, Mithuna, Simha, Tula, Dhanu, Kumbha - Aggressive, assertive, extroverted, outspoken - Make own decisions, less likely to seek advice


Saumya (Gentle/Female) - EVEN signs:
Vrishabha, Karkata, Kanya, Vrishchika, Makara, Meena - Passive, introverted, sustaining - More likely to seek guidance/advice
For Child Gender (Saptamsha only): - Mithuna & Karkata SWAP - Kumbha & Meena SWAP

title: PJC-1
text:
YUGA RASHIS (Dharma/Light Level)

Krita/Satya: Simha, Vrishchika, Kumbha, Vrishabha - Things come easily, 100% support
Treta: Mesha, Karkata, Tula, Makara - 75% support, some effort needed
Dwapara: Dhanu, Meena, Mithuna, Kanya - 50% support
Kali: (remaining context) - Least support

Usage: Shows how much support/ease person has in getting knowledge, solutions

title: PJC-1
text:
PLANETARY CABINET (Lordship Logic)
From Sun & Moon (King & Queen): 1. Sun & Moon - Leo & Cancer (King & Queen’s quarters) 2. Budha - Gemini & Virgo (Prince/Princess - next to parents) 3. Shukra - Taurus & Libra (Court ladies) 4. Mangala - Aries & Scorpio (Guards/Knights; Scorpio also has spies via Ketu) 5. Guru - Sagittarius & Pisces (Advisors/Priests/Ministers) 6. Shani - Capricorn & Aquarius (Workers/Commoners/Labor)
Also shows: Speed of planets from Earth (geocentric view)

title: PJC-1
text:
MEMORY AID: Hand Method
Fingers = 12 Rashis (4 fingers × 3 parts = 12)

Fingertips (top part) = Chara rashis (Mesha, Karkata, Tula, Makara) - Most mobile, doing karma
Middle sections = Sthira rashis (Vrishabha, Simha, Vrishchika, Kumbha) - Fixed, no free will
Base/Root = Dwi rashis (Mithuna, Kanya, Dhanu, Meena) - Most controlling lagnas!

Dual lagnas control through: - Budha lagnas (Mithuna/Kanya) - Control via information/details - Guru lagnas (Dhanu/Meena) - Control via knowledge/belief systems

title: PJC-1
text:
Lesson 6






CautionSummary of Lesson 6: Katapayadi & Bhava Chakras






1. KATAPAYADI SYSTEM (Numerical Values from Names)
Core Principle: Sanskrit consonants have numerical values (0-9)
Key Rules: - Vowels = 0 (only counted if name starts with vowel) - Use pronunciation, not spelling - Drop incomplete consonants (without following vowel) - Ra/La rule: If consonants joined with R or L, keep only initial consonant - Reverse the number after calculation - Divide by 12 to get remainder = Rashi
Example: Vivekananda - Consonants: Va-Ve-Ka-Na-Na-Da - Values: 4-4-1-0-8 - Number: 44108 → Reversed: 80144 - After dividing by 12 → Remainder = 4 (karka rahsi)
Usage: - Rashi (sign) = interaction with people - House number = inner manifestation



2. ASTRONOMICAL BASICS
Horizon: Where earth and sky meet (observer-dependent)
Key Points: - Udaya Lagna = Eastern horizon (rising point) - Asta Lagna = Western horizon (setting point) - 180° from Udaya - MC (Mid-Heaven/Zenith) = 90° above observer - Ecliptic = Horizontal plane between Sun & Earth
Directional Degrees: - North = 0°/360° - East = 90° - South = 180° - West = 270°



3. BHAVA CHAKRA (House System)
Method: Take Lagna degree ± 15 degrees = 30° house span
Example: Swami Vivekananda (26° Dhanu Lagna) - 1st House = 11° Dhanu to 11° Makara - 2nd House = 11° Makara to 11° Kumbha - And so on…
Result: Planets may shift houses if they’re within 15° of cusp
In Vivekananda’s chart: - Mars shifted from 5th → 4th house - Venus shifted from 2nd → 1st house - Jupiter shifted to 10th house
Significance: When many planets shift = major life transformations



4. BHAVA CHALIT CHAKRA
Starting Point: Uses Bhava Lagna (special lagna, moves 2 hours/sign)
Same process: Bhava Lagna degree ± 15°
Key Difference: - Bhava Chakra starts from Udaya Lagna - Bhava Chalit starts from Bhava Lagna (calculated separately)



5. BIOLOGICAL CLOCK CHART (Practical Application)
Setup: 1. Draw Bhava Chalit Chakra 2. Place 6 AM where Sun is located 3. Place 6 PM in 7th house from Sun 4. Each house = 2-hour period
Planet Activities & Best Times:








Planet
Activity
Best Time




Surya
Spiritual practice, energy level
Sun’s house + aspects


Chandra
Eating/food
Moon’s house + aspects


Mangala
Exercise, physical strength
Mars house + aspects (4th, 7th, 8th from itself)


Budha
Reading, learning, playing
Mercury’s house + aspects


Guru
Big decisions, digestion, conclusions
Jupiter’s house + aspects


Shukra
Relationships, indulgence
Venus’s house + aspects


Shani
Resting (15 min minimum)
Saturn’s house + aspects


Rahu
NO activity - meditation time
Rahu’s house + aspects


Ketu
Avoid activities - meditation
Ketu’s house + aspects



Important Notes: - Check planet’s aspects (5th, 7th, 9th, 2nd from itself for Rahu) - When planets conjunct = divide time between both activities - Each house = 2 hours, but find at least 15 min for that activity - Movement is anti-zodiacal (Sun moves through houses, not signs)



6. CHART TYPES (Three Representations)

Surya Chakra (East Indian) - for spirituality
Brigu Chakra (North Indian) - for Bhava Chakra
Guru Chakra (South Indian) - for Vastu

Practice tip: Use each chart exclusively for 1-3 months to master all types

Homework: Draw your Bhava Chalit Chakra and create your biological clock timing table!

title: PJC-1
text:
Lesson 7






CautionSummary of Lesson 7: Grahas (Planets) - Introduction






Opening Context

This is the first of three webinars on Grahas (planets)
Traditionally, Jyotish teaching starts with Chapter 3 (Grahas), not Chapters 1-2 (Creation/Philosophy)
Students should study Parashara shlokas at least 3 times to truly digest them
Use audio recordings from other batches as supplementary material




CORE DEFINITION: What is a Graha?
Parashara’s Definition (Chapter 3, Shloka 1): Heavenly bodies classified by: 1. Visibility (can we see them?) 2. Movement (do they move?)

Moving bodies = Graha (from root “grahana” = to seize/eclipse)
Fixed bodies = Nakshatra (fixed stars)

KEY POINT: Grahas have the inherent nature to eclipse the mind - this is their fundamental characteristic.



Why Rahu & Ketu are Grahas (Despite Having No Physical Body)
Question addressed: If we only count visible bodies, why include Rahu/Ketu?
Answer: - They are mathematical points (nodes of the Moon) - They create inverse light/shadow (like closing eyes after seeing sun = black circle) - They represent extremes of the mind: - Rahu = Fully material, maximum desire, wants to consume everything - Ketu = Fully detached, wants nothing, renunciation
Manifestations: - Rahu: Foreigners, different cultures, borders, geographical boundaries, fermentation, alcohol, medicine - Ketu: Outcasts, monks/nuns, spiritual people, those who renounce society - Example given: Man who moved to attic for years, refused all contact = clear Ketu influence



PLANETARY MOTION (Critical Concept)


Three Categories of Motion:

Always Direct (Forward):

Surya (Sun) & Chandra (Moon) - the Luminaries
Establish dharma, predictable, “one foot after another”

Always Retrograde (Backward):

Rahu & Ketu - the Nodes
Move opposite to all other planets
Cause eclipses when they meet luminaries

Can Be Either (Tara Grahas - 5 Planets):

Mangala, Budha, Guru, Shukra, Shani
When direct → behave like Luminaries (normal, predictable)
When retrograde → behave like Nodes (unpredictable, unfulfilled desires)





RETROGRADE PLANETS (Vakri)
Nature: Planet behaves like Rahu/Ketu
Characteristics: - Not progressing - standing still or pacing - Unfulfilled desire/karma with that planet - Unpredictable, odd behavior - Cannot be trusted (unexpected turns) - May not give results (especially in Prashna/horary)
Strength Implications: - Retrograde = Extremely strong (like nodes) - Has Cheshtabala (directional strength) - Can cause highest grahana (eclipse power)
Prashna (Horary) Rules: - If significator is vakri → Won’t happen (or needs 3 attempts) - 3x multiplier: 3x more effort, 3 attempts, or 3 blessings/children



EIGHT TYPES OF MOTION
5 Direct Motions: 1-5. (Various speeds of forward movement)
3 Retrograde Motions: 1. Vakra - Standard retrograde 2. Anu-vakra - Slowing down in retrograde 3. Kutila - Stationary (about to change direction)
IMPORTANT: Kutila applies to both transitions: - Direct → Retrograde - Retrograde → Direct



WHEN DO PLANETS GO RETROGRADE?
Outer Planets (Mars, Jupiter, Saturn):
Exercise given: Draw blank chart, place Jupiter on Lagna

120° from Sun (5th or 9th house) = Kutila (Stationary)

5th house = Just entering retrograde
9th house = Just finishing retrograde

180° from Sun (7th house) = Highest retrograde motion
6th house = Vakra (Mars nature)
8th house = Anu-vakra (Rahu nature)
4th/10th houses = Direct motion range

Inner Planets (Mercury, Venus): - Requires deep astronomical study (Surya Siddhanta) - Not explained in basic course



CHART EXAMPLE: Pandit Sanjay Rath
Jupiter: Sun in 5th from Jupiter → Jupiter stationary (velocity = 7, very low)
Saturn: Opposite Sun (7th house) → Highest retrograde (velocity = -223%)
Velocity Interpretation: - Minus (-) = Retrograde - Close to 0 = Stationary - High positive = Fast direct motion - High negative = Fast retrograde (double speed)
Note: No exact ranges given for motion types - must observe velocity values



DO WE MOVE RETROGRADE PLANETS IN THE CHART?
NO! Planet stays where it is.
Example: Retrograde boyfriend still behaves oddly, but he’s still your boyfriend in the same place.
What changes: - Planet gets nature of nodes - Can cancel exaltation/debilitation (taught in next lesson) - Creates yogas from its actual position



NAKSHATRA vs RASHI (Critical Distinction)
Question: Why do grahas show different colors in nakshatra vs rashi?
Answer - The Three Lokas:

Bhuloka (Earth) - Where we are

Rashis = All material resources, physical interactions

Bhuvarloka (Solar System) - Above us

Grahas = Moving planets, casting shadows

Svargaloka (Sky) - Above that

Nakshatras = Fixed stars, mental/emotional plane, devatas


How Grahas Work: - Grahas move through nakshatras (truth) - Cast shadow on both nakshatras AND rashis - Bind nakshatra significations with rashi significations
Nakshatras = Your thoughts, emotions, ideas (lunar, night concept) - Where graha is = your specific lens of thinking/feeling
Rashis = Material resources, physical things (everything you can see/touch) - Where graha is = where you experience grahana materially
Example: Two planets in same rashi but different nakshatras: - Working on same project (rashi) - But have different ideas/emotions about it (nakshatra)
Direction of influence works both ways: 1. Mental → Material: Thoughts manifest as actions 2. Material → Mental: Events cause us to think certain thoughts



FOUR TYPES OF LAGNA (Briefly Mentioned)
Not explained in detail (covered in separate lesson), but:
Birth Time Indicators: - Sun in 1st (Udaya Lagna) = Sunrise birth - Sun in 7th (Asta Lagna) = Sunset birth - Sun in 10th (Akasha Lagna) = Midday birth (~noon) - Sun in 4th (Jala Lagna) = Midnight birth



SAM-YOGA (Combinations)
Sam-yoga = ALL ways planets can combine (with planets, nakshatras, rashis)
Sam-bandha = Important combinations that have great impact - This is the term we use most - 4 specific types (one being conjunction/yuti)
Sam-yoga Sphuta = Mathematical meeting point of two planets - Calculated even if not in same rashi - Shows where yoga will manifest
Later: Yoga Sphuta can combine ANY two points (e.g., Lagna lord + 7th lord)



BHAVISHYA vs ATITA YOGA
Bhavishya Yoga = Yoga that will happen in future - Planets moving toward conjunction
Atita/Veeta Yoga = Yoga that happened in past - Planets moving apart after conjunction
Why calculate Atita Yoga Sphuta? - See where past yoga had impact - Useful for research/deep study of charts - Example: Two people with Chandra-Ketu in 11th - did it happen already or will it happen?
If yoga rashi not visible from yoga: - Don’t use seasons (mentioned but corrected) - Use Samukha-rashi (opposite/complementary signs) - Taught in Rashi Drishti module



GRAHA YUDHA (Planetary War)
Not taught in detail yet - comes in Year 3

4 types of interpretation
Related to Bala (strength) calculations
Just introduced as concept for now




KEY TERMINOLOGY TO REMEMBER

Graha = Planet that eclipses mind
Vakri = Retrograde
Kutila = Stationary
Sam-bandha = Important combination
Sam-yoga Sphuta = Meeting point of yoga
Bhavishya Yoga = Future yoga
Atita/Veeta Yoga = Past yoga
Prasanga = Planet that bridges gap (Year 3/4 topic)




HOMEWORK/NEXT STEPS

Study planetary motions in your own chart
Observe velocity values in software
Check if any retrograde planets present
Note which nakshatras vs rashis planets occupy
Prepare questions for next Graha webinar


Next Topics: Exaltation, debilitation, planetary relationships, yogas in detail

title: PJC-1
text:
Lesson 8






CautionSummary of Lesson 8: Graha Devatas & Karakas






1. ADI DEVATA MANTRAS (For Auspicious Beginnings)
Purpose: Worship when starting something new (job, family, project, book)








Graha

Key Point: Adi devatas are for awakening/starting activities.



2. PRATIYADI DEVATA MANTRAS (For Control & Sustenance)
Purpose: Control, sustain, protect, remove obstacles, complete karmas

Ketu

Key Difference: - Adi devata = Start things - Pratiyadi devata = Sustain, protect, correct, complete
When to Use: Based on dasha and current need (not all at once!)



3. FOUR KENDRAS & FOUR LAGNAS
Kendras represent Vishnu’s sustaining power

SAMADHI = Balance of all 4: Buddhi + Shuddhi + Siddhi + Riti



4. JOB/CAREER ANALYSIS (Practical Application)

Sattva Houses (Sustaining Job):
From Akasha Lagna (10th), count 4th, 5th, 9th, 12th houses. These become from your Lagna: 1st, 2nd, 6th, 9th

1st house = Mental ability to do job
2nd house = Wealth accumulated from job
6th house = Hard work capacity
9th house = Knowledge/education for job



Rajas Houses (Job Fluctuations):
Venus & Mercury signs from Akasha = 3rd, 4th, 11th, 12th from Lagna

3rd = Daily efforts, enterprise
4th = Love for job
11th = Income
12th = Losses from job



Tamas Houses (Job Changes):
Mars & Saturn signs from Akasha = 5th, 7th, 8th, 10th from Lagna

5th = New job appears
7th = Social responsibilities cause change
8th = Retirement, weakness
10th = Progress/ambition





5. ABHIJIT RASHI (4th from Sun)
Two Devatas: 1. Kubera = Wealth 2. Vishnu = Purity/Enlightenment
Choice: Do we choose wealth or enlightenment?
Reversal Principle: - 12th from Sun = What we GAIN (nature loses, we gain) - 2nd from Sun = What we LOSE (we give back to nature)



6. GUNA CHAKRA (Quality of Grahas)

Three Gunas with Borders:
SATTVA: Surya, Chandra, Guru (sustenance, protection) ↓ RAHU (border - attacks sattva) ↓ RAJAS: Budha (5), Shukra (6) ↓ KETU (border) ↓ TAMAS: Mangala, Shani
Numbers: Sy=1, Ch=2, Gu=3, Ra=4, Bu=5, Sk=6, Ke=7, Sa=8, Ma=9




7. FOUR GUNA TYPES (Character Classification)

Goal: Become Gunatita (beyond gunas)



8. SHADRIPUS (6 Enemies) & PANCHAMAKARAS (5 Elements to Avoid)

Shadripus (Mars karaka):

Kama - Desire
Krodha - Anger
Lobha - Greed
Moha - Attachment
Mada - Pride
Matsarya - Jealousy



Panchamakaras (Saturn karaka):

Madya - Alcohol/intoxication
Mamsa - Flesh/blood (damages Moon/Shanti)
Matsarya - Desire for others’ possessions
Maithuna - Copulation
Mudra - Inappropriate postures/touching

Relationship: Panchamakaras cause Shadripus

House where Sun placed = Area blessed by that Aditya



11. RASHI DOSHA APPLICATION
Key Point: Look at placement of dosha-carrying planet
Example: Mithuna lagna (Lakshmi dosha via Shukra) - Where is Venus placed? = Problematic area - Lordship also matters - Must check if planet is afflicted for bigger problems
Not all doom! Even afflicted placements in upachaya houses can give benefits.

title: PJC-1
text:
lesson 9






CautionCore Concept: Dig Bala (Directional Strength)





What it is: Planets gain special strength when placed in specific houses (kendras) from the lagna. Behind each planet in dig bala is a devata (deity) blessing that position.
Key Principle: Dig bala is a kendra-based concept - planets gain this strength in the 1st, 4th, 7th, or 10th houses from lagna.

The 10 Directions & Deities
Each of the 9 grahas plus lagna has a specific dig bala position: - Surya (10th house) - Indra’s blessing: oversight, control, statesmanship - Chandra (4th house) - Vayu’s blessing: speed, pranayama knowledge - Mangal (10th house) - Yama’s blessing: knowledge of borders, longevity, dasha - Budha (1st house) - Kubera’s blessing: knowledge of wealth - Guru (1st house) - Ishana’s blessing: full knowledge, reasoning (viveka) - Shukra (4th house) - Agni’s blessing: vision, ability to envision - Shani (7th house) - Varuna’s blessing: carrying burdens, labor knowledge - Rahu (7th house) - Niriti’s blessing: understanding chaos and its removal - Ketu (10th house) - Ananta’s blessing: meditation, spiritual introspection - Lagna (vargottama) - Mritunjaya blessing: longevity


How Dig Bala Works
From Lagna: The devata gives knowledge to the person - this is a blessing that can be strengthened through remedies
From Arudha Lagna: Shows the physical direction where blessings manifest (useful for relocation advice)


Important Rules

Conjunctions: When a dig bala planet conjoins another planet, it spills the blessing onto that planet (like an expensive house raising the value of a neighboring cheap house)
Dispositor is Key: The dispositor can lock or unlock the blessing - check its condition first. If doing remedies, worship the dispositor first, then the dig bala planet.
Zero Dig Bala: Opposite placement shows lack of knowledge in houses ruled by that planet - the person may be capable but unable to apply themselves in those areas
Independent of Sign: Dig bala works regardless of whether the planet is exalted, debilitated, or in own sign - these are separate layers of analysis



Practical Applications

Use dig bala as a remedy tool - it’s a blessing that can be strengthened
One strong benefit can lift an entire chart
For malefics in kendras, we prefer them weak (unless they’re lagna lord or have dig bala blessing)
Don’t do all remedies at once - address current dasha issues only



Examples Given
Abraham Lincoln: Budha (lagna lord) in 1st house conjunct Surya - Kubera’s wealth blessing manifested through Surya’s statesmanship. Rahu-Mangal in 9th activated through war/law-making but ultimately led to his death (Rahu in marana karaka sthana defeated by Mangal).

lesson 10






Caution





I’ll summarize this Vedic astrology lesson on Nakshatras. This is quite extensive, so let me break it into key sections:

Core Concept: Nakshatras & Thought Creation

27/28 Nakshatras are the Moon’s mansions, above and outside the Rashi chart
They represent thought creation - thoughts start in nakshatras, bubble up through divisional charts, and manifest in the Rashi chart
After manifestation, they return to nakshatras as emotions



Janma Nakshatra (Birth Moon’s Nakshatra)
The lord of your Janma Nakshatra shows your mental attitude:

Sun: Need to find a boss/God; work for others
Moon: Function best in family/gurukul settings
Mars: Prone to conflicts; must avoid them
Mercury: Difficulty finishing projects (Gandanta)
Jupiter: Seek knowledge, uphold tradition/dharma
Venus: Need purity/respect in relationships
Saturn: Break boundaries; good for innovation/research
Rahu: Face betrayal/disappointment; must stay honest
Ketu: Unsettled mind; need meditation (Gandanta)



Navtara Chakra (Three Columns)

Buloka (1st column): Personal well-being, youth
Buvaloka (2nd column): Career, social life, adulthood
Svargaloka (3rd column): Spiritual matters, elder age

Odd nakshatras (1st, 3rd, 5th, 7th) in first two columns are problematic; in spiritual column, challenges are beneficial.


Important Nakshatras from Moon

10th Nakshatra (Karma): Shows career/action capacity; same lord as Janma
25th Nakshatra (Manas): The pillar - most critical mental support point
7th & 22nd: Death/endings (Vadha)



Special Considerations

Shunya Nakshatra: Shows emptiness in certain rashis
Gandanta: Mercury (can’t finish) and Ketu (can’t start) create problems
Combustion by Sun: Cleansing through humiliation before improvement
Masa Nakshatra: Check Atmakaraka’s rashi to find problematic nakshatra lords



Key Teaching Points

Nakshatras show mental capacity, but Rashi chart shows manifestation
Both must support each other - genius without opportunity accomplishes nothing
Use 27-nakshatra scheme for practical work; 28 for spiritual matters
Check nakshatra lord’s placement in Rashi chart for full understanding

lesson 11






Caution





I’ll create a comprehensive summary of this Vedic astrology lesson on Graha Drishti (planetary aspects). This is quite detailed, so let me break it into key sections:

Lesson 11: Graha Drishti (Planetary Aspects) - Summary

Course Logistics

Monthly webinars recorded and available within 24 hours
2 years access to materials
Telegram group for daily questions
Daily practice: “Hare Rama Krishna” mantra (3 rounds of 108) upon waking
Recommended software: Jagannatha Hora (free) or Shri Jyoti Star (paid)



Core Concepts of Graha Drishti
Definition: Graha drishti is planetary aspect - the ability of planets (movable bodies) to influence other bodies from certain positions. It represents: - Expression of desire (temporary, activated during dashas or through mantras) - Ability to influence based on position - What the planet is viewing/becoming aware of - What the planet prioritizes


Four Types of Graha Drishti
1. Outer Planets (have multiple aspects):

Saturn - Upachaya/Growth Drishti: 3rd and 10th houses

Focus: Work, daily effort (parakrama)
Makara lagna natives are workaholics, constantly discussing work

Jupiter - Trikona/Knowledge Drishti: 5th and 9th houses

Focus: Knowledge acquisition
5th = new knowledge; 9th = past knowledge/education from guru
Jupiter lagna natives prioritize learning above all

Mars - Raksha/Security Drishti: 4th and 8th houses

Focus: Protection and security
4th = inner security (home, mother, protection)
8th = outer security (external threats)
Tests security by provoking/poking (like throwing stones at glass)
Martial lagna natives can be defensive


2. Inner Planets (Kendra planets):

Sun, Moon, Venus, Mercury - Purna/Full Drishti: 7th house only

Represents desire for that specific planet’s significations
Sun: desire for self-expression
Venus: desire for partnership/comfort
Moon: sustenance
Mercury: communication


3. Rahu - Kama Drishti: 2nd and 7th houses - Represents desire to possess, enjoy, consume
4. Ketu: Has no graha drishti (withdrawn nature)


Practical Applications
Using Raksha Drishti (4th & 8th from lords):

Marriage (from 7th lord):

4th from 7th lord = inner marriage issues (disharmony, lack of intimacy)
8th from 7th lord = outer threats (affairs, third parties)

Work (from 10th lord):

4th from 10th lord = inner work issues (colleagues, internal problems)
8th from 10th lord = job change, loss, looking elsewhere

Wealth (from 2nd lord):

4th from 2nd lord = protecting wealth internally
8th from 2nd lord = external threats (taxes, theft)


Using Kriya Drishti (3rd & 10th - Saturn’s aspects): - 3rd = new work/initiatives - 10th = old work/unresolved issues
Using Jnana Drishti (5th & 9th - Jupiter’s aspects): - 5th = new knowledge/skills to learn - 9th = past knowledge/education/baggage - Afflicted 9th can mean stuck in perpetual education


Analysis Methods
Can analyze from three perspectives: 1. Bhava (house) - general/Kalapurusha chart 2. Bhava Lord - individual chart specifics 3. Karaka - natural significator


Atmakaraka Application
Permanent Nature: Shown by Atmakaraka’s purna drishti - Indicates soul’s highest priorities - Example: Jupiter as AK in 9th house prioritizes knowledge of 1st house (self, health, birth purpose) and 5th house (children, future, mantras)
Temporal Nature: Shown by Mahadasha lord’s purna drishti - Current life priorities during that period


Important Notes

All planets have all aspects, but purna drishti shows HIGHEST priority
Retrograde planets have 3x stronger desire/influence (Cheshtabala)
Afflicted 9th house can indicate educational blocks preventing career progress
For severe afflictions, only analyze purna drishti; for other analyses, may use partial aspects too
Jupiter not natural leader because priorities are knowledge (5th/9th), not protection (4th/8th) or governance



Homework Assignment

Draw your chart and mark all houses your Atmakaraka has purna drishti on
Apply this to 10 charts of people you know well
Journal conclusions about what worked/didn’t work


Would you like me to clarify any specific aspect of this lesson, or shall we explore how to apply these concepts to a chart?

Lesson 12






Caution





I’ll provide a comprehensive summary of this Vedic astrology lesson on Rashi Drishti (sign aspects). This is a detailed transcript, so I’ll break it into key sections:

Core Concept: Rashi Drishti vs Graha Drishti
Rashi Drishti is fundamentally different from Graha Drishti: - Graha Drishti = planetary desire to influence; changes with dashas/transits (temporary) - Rashi Drishti = permanent natural functioning; mutual sharing of information between signs; exists throughout time
Key example: Mars in Mesha and Guru in Vrishika have mutual rashi drishti (knowledge sharing), but only Mars has graha drishti on Guru (8th aspect), not vice versa.


Three Types of Rashi Drishti

1. Abhimukha Drishti (Face-to-Face, 100%)

Signs directly opposite each other
Represents Vishnu tatva (sustenance)
Mutual dependency for survival
Examples:

Mesha-Vrishika: Body health depends on waste elimination
Rishabha-Tula: Family needs partnership
Mithuna-Dhanus: Contracts need knowledge (9th house)
Karka-Makara: Heart rhythm-life cycle (rebirth)


Protection principle: Planets in abhimukha signs protect each other, especially the sign lord and exalted planet. Malefics in abhimukha can jeopardize sustenance.


2. Parshva Drishti (Side Aspects, 50%)
Two types: - First Parshva (creation side) - Brahma tatva - Second Parshva (destruction side) - Rudra tatva (also called Badaka)
For Mesha: Simha (creation), Vrishika (sustenance/abhimukha), Kumbha (destruction/badaka)


3. Badaka (Obstacle, 25%)
The “destruction” parshva - represents overconfidence where we think we know but don’t.
Badaka rules: - Chara (movable) signs: 11th house is badaka - Sthira (fixed) signs: 9th house is badaka
- Dvisvabhava (dual) signs: 7th house is badaka
The badaka moves in 3-step pattern opposite to Vishnu’s movement through signs.



Samukha Drishti (Opposite Signs)
Signs 180° apart represent the same quality with different manifestations - two sides of one coin. You can only choose one side: - Mesha-Vrishika (Mars): Warrior vs spiritual/occult - Rishabha-Tula: Family establishment vs wandering - Mithuna-Dhanus: Worldly involvement vs sannyasa


Practical Application Method
When analyzing any rashi, examine four positions: 1. The rashi itself 2. Its creation source (first parshva) 3. Its sustenance (abhimukha) 4. Its destruction/obstacles (badaka)
Check both from: - Lagna (intellectual ability) - Lagna lord placement (practical application ability)


Chart Examples Analyzed
Srila Prabhupada (Dhanus lagna): - Abhimukha = Mithuna (7th house challenge: samsara vs sannyasa) – ** this is incorrec i think it is samukha rashi ** - From lagna lord (Guru in 9th/Simha): Abhimukha is Makara (2nd) with exalted Shani - successfully faced challenge, established family then took sannyasa - Parshva knowledge: Meena (4th house purity/bhakti) - Applied through exalted Shani - uplifted drug users/hippies to vegetarianism and Krishna consciousness
Kurt Cobain (Simha lagna): - Abhimukha = Makara (6th) with Shani-Venus (desires/vices problem) - Knowledge source (Tula) lords over badaka - created own blockages - Fame he couldn’t handle, led to suicide


Important Technical Points

Planets in badaka can be blessing (if benefic) or curse (if malefic)
Guru in badaka doesn’t mean no guru if benefic
Lords and exalted planets of signs are “blind protectors”
Retrograde planets in protective positions add stubbornness to protection
Debilitated planets in protective positions cannot protect properly
Marana karaka sthana creates additional problems in badaka



Sign Dependencies
The transcript lists which planets protect which signs (lord + exalted planet for each).

Lesson 13






Caution





I’ll provide a comprehensive summary of this Jyotish (Vedic astrology) lesson on Bhavas (houses):

Core Concepts
Bhava Definition - Bhavas are not static areas of life but dynamic states of mind, attitudes, sentiments, and experiences - They grow and expand based on knowledge and awareness - Three ways to define bhavas: Narayana (rashi-based), Bhava Chakra (degree-based), and Bhava Chalita Chakra
Bhava Names The 12 houses have specific Sanskrit names that reveal their significance: Lagna, Dhana, Sahaja, Sukha, Putra, Ari, Yuvati, Randhra, Dharma, Karma, Labha, Vyaya


Bhava Groups and Underlying Principles
Kendras (1st, 4th, 7th, 10th) - Vishnu/Moon concept - Most important houses - the four pillars of life - Visualized as a four-petal lotus - Only houses we have direct access to - 1st & 7th: High tide (high emotions) - birth/coming and going/journey - 4th & 10th: Low tide (rest/relaxation) - home and work - Planets in kendras cooperate and support each other
Konas (5th, 9th) - Lakshmi/Shiva concept - Resources and knowledge that sustain life - Represent prosperity and dharma - 5th house: Future, mantra, prayers, visualization, children - 9th house: Past, guru knowledge, father, lineage, dharma - When bhava lords are placed in konas, they show what you pray for or admire
Dusthanas (6th, 8th, 12th) - Shani/Saturn concept - Represent sorrow, sin, and karmic debts - Planets here have “taxes” to pay - 6th house: Weaknesses (shadripu), temptations, lifestyle choices, celibacy - FREE WILL - 8th house: Past sins (rina), karmic debts, unseen diseases - NO FREE WILL - 12th house: Losses, foreign residence, blame
Upachaya Houses (3rd, 6th, 10th, 11th) - Free will houses - Have potential to grow and develop - Lagna lord in 3rd/6th: Manta Yoga (extreme intelligence) - Lagna lord in 10th/11th: Siddha Yoga (huge achievements) - 3rd: Choice of weapon/expression - 6th: Dealing with enemies/temptations - 10th: Keeping promises, work - 11th: Gains - what you’re willing to accept/take
Trikona (3rd, 6th, 11th) - Brahma houses - Contribute to our creation - 3rd & 6th: Creation part - 11th: Delivery part - Related to Rahu (cause of birth) - 6th house: Body creation (with Brahma) - 12th house: Mind creation (with Saraswati)


Practical Examples
Travel & Foreign Residence - 7th house: Journey and movement (not residence) - 10th house: Away from home - 12th house: Foreign residence/settlement - 3rd house: Short-term travel - 9th house: Freedom to travel (visa/permits)
Children - Male chart: 5th house for progeny - Female chart: 9th house for progeny, conception, pregnancy
Judgment of Bhavas - Benefic planets in a house bring happiness (sukha) - If bhava lord is in kendra/kona from lagna, that bhava is empowered - Example: 6th lord in kendras strengthens celibacy, can delay marriage
Lord Placement - From lagna: Shows our experience of that bhava - From the bhava itself: Shows resources available to that bhava - In kendra: God-given, accessible - In kona: Need to pray for it, seek knowledge - In dusthana: Sin/sorrow attached


Key Teachings

Increasing knowledge of bhavas changes their quality
Each bhava has multiple names revealing different aspects
Mantras (5th house) include all mental repetitions, not just Sanskrit prayers
Your mantra is your best friend or worst enemy
Malefics in houses show specific challenges related to that house’s significations

The lesson emphasized understanding WHY classical texts say what they do, not just memorizing combinations.

title: PJC-1
text:
Core Concepts
Bhava Definition - Bhavas are not static areas of life but dynamic states of mind, attitudes, sentiments, and experiences - They grow and expand based on knowledge and awareness - Three ways to define bhavas: Narayana (rashi-based), Bhava Chakra (degree-based), and Bhava Chalita Chakra
Bhava Names The 12 houses have specific Sanskrit names that reveal their significance: Lagna, Dhana, Sahaja, Sukha, Putra, Ari, Yuvati, Randhra, Dharma, Karma, Labha, Vyaya

title: PJC-1
text:
Bhava Groups and Underlying Principles
Kendras (1st, 4th, 7th, 10th) - Vishnu/Moon concept - Most important houses - the four pillars of life - Visualized as a four-petal lotus - Only houses we have direct access to - 1st & 7th: High tide (high emotions) - birth/coming and going/journey - 4th & 10th: Low tide (rest/relaxation) - home and work - Planets in kendras cooperate and support each other
Konas (5th, 9th) - Lakshmi/Shiva concept - Resources and knowledge that sustain life - Represent prosperity and dharma - 5th house: Future, mantra, prayers, visualization, children - 9th house: Past, guru knowledge, father, lineage, dharma - When bhava lords are placed in konas, they show what you pray for or admire
Dusthanas (6th, 8th, 12th) - Shani/Saturn concept - Represent sorrow, sin, and karmic debts - Planets here have “taxes” to pay - 6th house: Weaknesses (shadripu), temptations, lifestyle choices, celibacy - FREE WILL - 8th house: Past sins (rina), karmic debts, unseen diseases - NO FREE WILL - 12th house: Losses, foreign residence, blame
Upachaya Houses (3rd, 6th, 10th, 11th) - Free will houses - Have potential to grow and develop - Lagna lord in 3rd/6th: Manta Yoga (extreme intelligence) - Lagna lord in 10th/11th: Siddha Yoga (huge achievements) - 3rd: Choice of weapon/expression - 6th: Dealing with enemies/temptations - 10th: Keeping promises, work - 11th: Gains - what you’re willing to accept/take
Trikona (3rd, 6th, 11th) - Brahma houses - Contribute to our creation - 3rd & 6th: Creation part - 11th: Delivery part - Related to Rahu (cause of birth) - 6th house: Body creation (with Brahma) - 12th house: Mind creation (with Saraswati)

title: PJC-1
text:
Practical Examples
Travel & Foreign Residence - 7th house: Journey and movement (not residence) - 10th house: Away from home - 12th house: Foreign residence/settlement - 3rd house: Short-term travel - 9th house: Freedom to travel (visa/permits)
Children - Male chart: 5th house for progeny - Female chart: 9th house for progeny, conception, pregnancy
Judgment of Bhavas - Benefic planets in a house bring happiness (sukha) - If bhava lord is in kendra/kona from lagna, that bhava is empowered - Example: 6th lord in kendras strengthens celibacy, can delay marriage
Lord Placement - From lagna: Shows our experience of that bhava - From the bhava itself: Shows resources available to that bhava - In kendra: God-given, accessible - In kona: Need to pray for it, seek knowledge - In dusthana: Sin/sorrow attached

title: PJC-1
text:
Lesson 14






Caution





I’ll provide a comprehensive summary of this Vedic astrology lesson on Bhava lords (house lords). This is a detailed technical lecture, so I’ll organize it systematically.

Core Framework: Four Essential Templates
The instructor emphasizes creating templates for understanding how bhava lords function, focusing on the first four house lords.



1. LAGNESHA (1st Lord) - The Fire Element
Key Principle: Lagnesha functions like Agni (fire) - similar to Mars and Surya, as they rule the 1st house in Kalpurusha.
The Burning/Digesting Effect: - Wherever Lagnesha sits, it “burns” or “digests” that house’s resources - Even Lagnesha in Lagna causes a burning/cleansing process before positive outcomes - Resources are taken from the house where Lagnesha sits and added to the 1st house
Houses from Lagnesha (Pacha Lagna):
Positive Houses (what we like/support): - Kendras (1st, 4th, 7th, 10th): Houses we can directly access, our pillars of life - Konas (5th, 9th): Knowledge and resources we can obtain - 3rd house: Parakrama - courage, spiritual potential, effort - 4th house (Mars aspect): Joy, security (but also Mars’s neecha - fragile, needs protection) - 7th house: How people feel when interacting with us; cooling effect - 8th house (Mars aspect): Desire to intervene; what we must resolve to rise - 10th house: Success, exalted state (Mars’s uchcha)
Negative Houses (Gupthanas - what we reject): - 6th, 8th, 12th from Lagnesha: Things we don’t like or want
Additional Layers: - 2nd house: Public/professional enjoyment (dhyana) - 12th house: Private life/intimacy (mining) - High tide houses (1st, 7th): High emotions, strong attachment - Low tide houses (4th, 10th): Rest, less emotional charge
Three Ganas from Lagnesha: - 6th house: Rakshasa gana - where we show no mercy; people may fear us - 8th house: Deva gana - enjoyment without control; addictions/obsessions - 12th house: Manushya gana - selfishness, hoarding tendencies



2. DHANESHA (2nd Lord) - Wealth & Attitude
Key Principle: Shows our attitude toward wealth and what we consider valuable (not just money).
Important Houses from Dhanesha: - 3rd house: Social enterprise - efforts to gain wealth - 4th house: Attitude toward wealth (sharing vs. hoarding) - 5th house: Source of wealth - 6th house: Meetings/interactions needed to gain wealth - 7th house: Debts we must take - 9th house: Agreements/responsibilities for wealth - 11th house: Source of expenditure (opposite of 5th) - 12th house: Who controls the wealth (if afflicted, can lose everything)



3. SAHAJAYESHA (3rd Lord) - Efforts & Spirituality
Key Principle: Shows where we put effort and our Guru Padasha (spiritual path). Also relates to copulation/relationships.
Important Houses from Sahajayesha: - 3rd house: Object of efforts - where we gladly work hard - 4th house: Where we’re tired/impatient, don’t want effort - 5th house: Reasons for interaction/copulation - 7th house: Fulfillment of desires (especially sexual/relationship) - 9th house: What comes naturally/easily to us - 10th house: Source of partners (including sexual partners); also moksha through guru padasha
Note: 3rd house combines Mars (courage, aggression) with Mercury (intellect) - creates the dilemma between spiritual path (flute) and worldly action (mace).



4. SUKHESA (4th Lord) - Happiness & Purity
Key Principle: The guardian providing sukha (happiness). Functions like Moon (both karaka and lord). Represents purity and Vishnu consciousness.
Important Houses from Sukhesa: - 3rd house: Tarana - tests/conditions we must pass to reach happiness - 4th house: Places of comfort/enjoyment - 5th house: What we fear (Moon’s neecha in Scorpio) - fragile area causing anxiety - 7th house: Icha - desires we think will make us happy - 8th house: What we neglect (people who may be unhappy due to our happiness) - 9th house: Vishnu - ultimate objective of happiness - 10th house: Negative karma preventing happiness - 11th house: Values of our purity (Moon’s uchcha in Taurus)



Critical Counting Rules
From Lagna Lord ONLY (exception): - Lagna → Lord = suffering - Lord → Lagna = achievement
For ALL other lords: - Lord → Bhava = suffering - Bhava → Lord = achievement



Methodology Guidance

Draw these templates first - they’re your foundation
Add details gradually - karakas, yogas, aspects, etc.
Use real charts from astro-databank for practice
Mark exceptions in red to investigate later
Don’t judge from one placement - need confirmation from multiple angles
Natural lords matter: Each bhava lord carries essence of Kalpurusha lord (e.g., all lagneshas have Mars/Surya qualities)




Key Teaching Points

Bhavas are dynamic, not static - they grow with knowledge
Lords show karma associated with that bhava
Lord in Kendra/Kona from Lagna = empowered bhava
Bhava groups (Kendra, Kona, Dusthana, Upachaya, Trika) have underlying principles
This is first layer only - more layers (yogas, arudhas, etc.) come later

The instructor emphasized this is a template approach - learn the systematic framework first, then add complexity through practice and additional study.

title: PJC-1
text:
Lesson 15






Caution





I’ll provide a comprehensive summary of this Jyotish webinar on Bhavesha (house lords). This covers lessons on the 4th-7th house lords:

Core Teaching Philosophy
Bhava as Dynamic Experience - Bhavas are not static but grow with knowledge and awareness - They represent states of mind, attitudes, and experiences - “By increasing knowledge of bhava we change the quality of the bhava”


5th House Lord (Mantraesha) - Key Principles
Natural Energies: - Carries energy of Surya (natural 5th lord) and Jupiter (karaka) - Creates “trines” that shine - wherever 5th lord sits, 5th and 9th from there also illuminated
Main Effects: - Shows where we apply ourselves, what we study and learn - House opposite (7th from 5th lord) stays in darkness - what we neglect - Linked to Agni planets (Sun/Mars/Ketu) = love of Jyotish study - Shows what we love and have devotion for
Negative: When linked to 6th/8th/12th houses (Saturn’s domain) = clash of Sun/Saturn energies, can show taxation through that house


6th House Lord (Shastraesha) - Detailed Template
Core Nature: - “Master of vices” - represents shadripu (six weaknesses/toxic thoughts) - Has “dirt” that contaminates 2nd and 12th houses from its placement - Karaka: Saturn; Natural lord: Mercury
Key Drishtis to Check: - 3rd from 6th lord: Growth potential (Saturn’s future aspect) - 10th from 6th lord: What mind dwells on (Saturn’s past focus) - 7th from 6th lord: What enemies/thieves want to steal
Special Combination: - 6th lord in 1st/8th house: Anger when hungry (due to Agni/Mars connection)
Important: 6th house = lifestyle choices (free will), unlike 8th house (karmic debt, no free will)


7th House Lord (Daresha) - Most Complex
Natural Energies: - Heavy Rajas (Shukra as lord and karaka) - Connected to Vaiyo (movement) and Shiva Linga - Saturn has digbala here
Relationship Protection: - 4th from 7th lord: Internal protection in relationship (if afflicted = internal problems/bickering) - 8th from 7th lord: External protection (affairs, outside dangers) - 7th from 7th lord: Highest desire for relationship (Shukra’s icha)
Other Key Houses: - 9th from 7th lord: Vivaha dharma - where marriage finds fulfillment - 3rd from 7th lord: Shiva’s blessing/curse on couple - 10th from 7th lord: Related to Shiva’s blessings - 11th from 7th lord: Potential health issues
Compatibility Rule (VERY IMPORTANT): - For couples, 7th lords should be in kendra to each other - This = blessing of Vayu and Shiva = couple walks life path together - Alternative: 7th lords in signs of same planet, or connected by parivartana - Without this: Bio (separation) through coldness, distance, lack of communication
Critical Distinction: - 7th house = your state/experience of relationships - 7th lord = the actual partners/people coming into your life - 7th lord in dusthana from 7th = lack of availability of partners - BUT once you have partner, then Parashara’s results manifest


8th House Lord (Ashtamesha) - The Redemption House
Core Understanding: - Shows past life karma - both blessings and debts - “Why did this happen to me?” feeling = past life deeds - Two types of taxes: Health tax (2nd from 8th lord) and Wealth tax (5th from 8th lord)
Key Principles: - Stay with 8th lord and clean it up - this is your debt to pay - Check who the 8th lord is (Moon/Mercury/Venus etc.) to understand type of suffering
Three Salvations (Relief from 8th Lord): 1. 8th lord in good house 2. 8th lord in good sign
3. 8th lord conjoined benefic = blessing from past life (Rudra’s blessing)
Important Houses from 8th Lord: - 2nd: Health tax (check graha there for body part affected) - 3rd: Where coldness helps spiritual progress (Saturn’s growth) - 4th: Immediate relief (run here when pressure is high) - 5th: Wealth tax, who suffers financially - 7th: Icha (desire) but manifests as cruelty - DON’T RUIN THIS HOUSE - 8th: External pressure - best to avoid/run away from - 9th: Naraka (hell), places you get kicked out of - 10th: Mantra that can heal 8th house - 11th: Snakes talking - backstabbing, cruel language, provocation (don’t respond!)
Remedies (Natural 8th House Solutions): - Respect astrologers and doctors - Work on higher/spiritual self - Follow yamas/niyamas (do’s and don’ts) - Rishi mantras - Don’t kill, steal, lie, betray - Observe dietary discipline
Teacher’s Personal Example: - Dhanu lagna, 8th lord Moon in 9th with Sun (Amavasya dosha) - Malefic effect: War trauma, alcoholic father, many deaths witnessed - BUT Jupiter conjunct = blessing activated at age 15-16 - Result: Became vegetarian, started meditation = complete life change - 4th from 8th lord (12th house) gave relief through meditation and living abroad


Critical Teaching Points
Common Mistakes to Avoid: 1. Not checking both karaka AND natural lord of house 2. Forgetting that lord’s placement from lagna = our experience 3. Forgetting that lord’s placement from bhava = resources available to that bhava 4. Not considering dignity (exaltation/debilitation), yogas, parivartana, combustion, curses 5. Relying on ready-made tables instead of understanding principles
Why No Ready-Made Tables: - Creates lazy minds - Growth comes from working through each combination - Must understand WHY rishis said what they said
When Two Lords (Dual Signs): - Study both lords - See which is stronger, more prominent - Check which links to lagna or atmakaraka - Two lords = confusion in that area of life - For 7th house: Be careful if 7th and 12th share same lord
Philosophy on 8th House: - Never discuss 8th lord problems with clients directly (energy too heavy) - Instead: Give remedies, show relief paths, warn what to avoid - Focus on solutions, not doom - Nothing is black and white - always many layers and colors - Nothing lasts forever


Practical Application
The teacher emphasized that for any prediction, you need: - Who is the lord (planet) - What is the dignity (exalted/debilitated/etc.) - What yogas are formed - Any parivartana - Any combustion/afflictions - Conjunction with benefics/malefics
This is a complete framework for understanding how house lords operate based on their natural lordship, karaka, and the specific principles governing each house.
Would you like me to elaborate on any specific house lord or principle?

title: PJC-1
text:
Lesson 16






Caution





I’ll provide a comprehensive summary of this Jyotish lesson on Bhavesha (house lordships), focusing on the final four houses (9th-12th).

Core Teaching Principles
Important Limitations: - Cannot make final conclusions based solely on bhavesha placement - Must consider: strength (bala), yogas, karaka influences, and divisional charts - Bhavesha analysis is one layer of a complete chart reading
Two Ways to Analyze Bhavesha: 1. As Karaka: Shows destiny/divine support (hand of God) 2. As Natural Lord: Shows external efforts required


9th House - Bhagyesha (Lord of Fortune)
Primary Concept: Source of fortune and luck
Key Analysis Points: - Where 9th lord is placed = source of your fortune - 9th lord well-placed from lagna = experience happiness from that house - 9th lord well-placed from 9th house = resources available to that bhava
Critical Houses from Bhagyesha:
Rudra Tests (3rd & 10th from 9th lord) - Shani’s 3rd & 10th drishti: - Must keep these houses pure - 3rd from 9th lord: Financial issues if afflicted - 10th from 9th lord: Sorrow/depression if afflicted - Failure in these tests blocks fortune
Security Houses (4th & 8th from 9th lord) - Mangal’s aspects: - 4th: Security in birth family - 8th: Security in established family - Malefics here = insecurity, not belonging
Kama Drishti (7th from 9th lord): - Shows what you think you need to achieve for happiness - Very sensitive house
Expansion (2nd from 9th lord): - What naturally expands your fortune - Malefics here block this expansion
Rishi Entrance (12th from 9th lord): - Where spiritual knowledge enters - Malefics block this flow - Check sapta rishis and lordship
Bhakti & Support: - 5th from 9th lord: Seed of bhakti, mantra - 9th from 9th lord: Highest fortune support
Critical Rule: 9th house must be kept pure - remedies essential for tamasic grahas in 9th house, especially Rahu (biggest problem)


10th House - Karmesha (Lord of Karma/Work)
Primary Concept: HOW we work (not what job we do) - our work attitude
Four Karakas: 1. Budha (primary): Skills and desire for work 2. Shani: Labor/effort willing to put in, failures 3. Guru: Success and fruits of work 4. Surya: Societal need for our work
Grahas in 10th Show Work Style by Ritu (Season): - Surya/Mangal/Ketu (Grishma-summer): Work intensely early, need rest after - hot season pattern - Shukra (Vasant-spring): Demand comfort, aesthetics in workplace - Chandra (Varsha-rainy): Prefer closed spaces, need roof overhead - Budha (Sharad-autumn): Must know fruits of labor before starting - Guru (Hemanta-festival): Positive attitude, enjoy work itself - Shani/Rahu (Shishira-cold): Slow but steady, can work in difficult conditions
Key Houses from Karmesha:
Labor Houses (3rd & 10th from 10th lord) - Shani drishti: - 3rd: Mental labor, new ideas, new projects (Budha brings new) - 10th: Physical labor, mastering old projects (Shani improves existing)
Success & Dharma (5th & 9th from 10th lord) - Guru aspects: - 5th: Attainment of fruits of labor - 9th: Dharma in how we do work
Job Changes: - 8th from 10th lord: New job (same field, different company) - 11th from 10th lord: Complete career change (engineer to painter) - 4th from 10th lord: Why we stop working (health leave, vacation, firing)
Motivation (7th from 10th lord): - Shows what motivates us to work - Malefics here affect motivation quality
Blessings: Where 10th lord placed = blessings of Durga and Kubera (energy to do work)


11th House - Labesha (Lord of Gains)
Primary Concept: Measurement of time in this life, rebirth house
Karaka: Guru (so 5th & 9th from 11th lord = confusion, lack of knowledge)
Key Houses from Labesha:
Effort & Transformation (3rd & 10th from 11th lord) - Shani drishti: - 3rd: Intelligence efforts to increase gains - 10th: Ability/willingness to transform for quality time on earth
Objective (11th from 11th lord): - Shows what we really want to gain
Wealth (2nd & 4th from 11th lord): - 2nd: Daily cash flow - 4th: Actual stored wealth
Balance & Rejuvenation: - 7th from 11th lord: Perfect balance in gains/losses, satisfaction point - 6th from 11th lord: Where we rejuvenate, energy flows
Spiritual Perspective: Gaining = buying (future payback); Losing = liberation (spiritually better)


12th House - Vyayesha (Lord of Liberation/Loss)
Primary Concept: Liberation, moksha - lord wants to set us free
Karakas: - Shani (primary) - Ketu (exalted) - Shukra (exalted) - Together = Tapasvi Yoga (great spiritual achievement ability)
Critical Concept - HAMMER HOUSES (3rd, 10th, & placement of 12th lord): - These are where losses can hit hard - Shani drishti from Vyayesha
The Requirement: Must not be greedy, must be willing to give/sacrifice
TRIGGER (4th from 12th lord): - This is the “rope” holding the hammers - Keep this house clean = hammers won’t hit - If 12th lord in lagna, respect mother - If in 2nd, respect kids/students, pure mantras
Other Key Houses:
Vices (7th from 12th lord): - What vices we’re prone to - Must be very careful here
Prayer & Temple (5th & 9th from 12th lord): - 5th: How we pray/meditate (graha shows deity preference) - 9th: Our temple, puja place
12th House Rules: Immune system, losses, very important for marriage, requires regular meditation


General Principles Across All Houses
Malefic Influence Levels: 1. One malefic = nervousness (comes and goes) 2. Two malefics = problem requiring solution (has solution) 3. Three malefics = problem from inside, very difficult to remedy (both vayu and agni present)
Mitigation: Benefic conjunct malefic provides some relief
Retrograde Benefics: Bring stubbornness, won’t give up easily
Multiple Lordships: Stronger lord determined by: - More conjunctions - Higher dignity - “Democracy principle” - majority rules
This lesson emphasizes understanding the underlying principles and logic of why classical texts say what they do, preparing students for the Bhavadhyaya module where they’ll study all 144 combinations of house lords in houses.

title: PJC-1
text:
Core Teaching Principles
Important Limitations: - Cannot make final conclusions based solely on bhavesha placement - Must consider: strength (bala), yogas, karaka influences, and divisional charts - Bhavesha analysis is one layer of a complete chart reading
Two Ways to Analyze Bhavesha: 1. As Karaka: Shows destiny/divine support (hand of God) 2. As Natural Lord: Shows external efforts required

title: PJC-1
text:
9th House - Bhagyesha (Lord of Fortune)
Primary Concept: Source of fortune and luck
Key Analysis Points: - Where 9th lord is placed = source of your fortune - 9th lord well-placed from lagna = experience happiness from that house - 9th lord well-placed from 9th house = resources available to that bhava
Critical Houses from Bhagyesha:
Rudra Tests (3rd & 10th from 9th lord) - Shani’s 3rd & 10th drishti: - Must keep these houses pure - 3rd from 9th lord: Financial issues if afflicted - 10th from 9th lord: Sorrow/depression if afflicted - Failure in these tests blocks fortune
Security Houses (4th & 8th from 9th lord) - Mangal’s aspects: - 4th: Security in birth family - 8th: Security in established family - Malefics here = insecurity, not belonging
Kama Drishti (7th from 9th lord): - Shows what you think you need to achieve for happiness - Very sensitive house
Expansion (2nd from 9th lord): - What naturally expands your fortune - Malefics here block this expansion
Rishi Entrance (12th from 9th lord): - Where spiritual knowledge enters - Malefics block this flow - Check sapta rishis and lordship
Bhakti & Support: - 5th from 9th lord: Seed of bhakti, mantra - 9th from 9th lord: Highest fortune support
Critical Rule: 9th house must be kept pure - remedies essential for tamasic grahas in 9th house, especially Rahu (biggest problem)

title: PJC-1
text:
Lesson 17






Caution





I’ll provide a comprehensive summary of this Vedic astrology lesson on Aprakasha Grahas (invisible planets). This is quite detailed, so let me break it into digestible sections.

Core Concept: What are Aprakasha Grahas?
Aprakasha Grahas are five invisible celestial points (not physical planets) that can eclipse or disturb the five Pancha Tattwas (elements). They are:

Dhuma - afflicts Agni (fire)
Vyatipata - afflicts Prithvi (earth)
Parivesha - afflicts Akasha (space/ether)
Indrachapa - afflicts Jala (water)
Upaketu/Apaketu - afflicts Vayu (air)

These are called “aprakasha” (without light) because they are invisible points that can disturb or destroy the light/purity of the tattwas.


The Papa Purusha Chakra
This is visualized as an upside-down man (stick figure in black), representing how these points function:

Dhuma - in the head (starts from Scorpio, moves forward)
Vyatipata - right hand (starts from Libra, moves backward)
Parivesha - left hand (starts from Virgo, moves forward)
Indrachapa - right leg (starts from Leo, moves forward)
Upaketu - left leg (starts from Cancer, moves backward)

Key principle: Left arm and right leg work together (move in harmony), as do right hand and left leg.


How to Read Results
When reading Parashara’s results for these grahas in houses, you read from the Lagna BUT the results correspond to their “starting” rashi:

Dhuma in 1st house = Scorpio-like results (8th house nature)
Dhuma in 2nd house = Sagittarius-like results (9th house nature)
And so on…



Three Levels of Interpretation
Level 1: Rashi Dispositor (Physical Manifestation) - If Aprakasha graha is alone in a house, see the lord of that rashi (dispositor) - The dispositor’s placement shows WHERE and HOW the affliction manifests physically - Exception: If dispositor is in own sign/mulatrikona/exaltation, the sin is cleared - the graha cannot reach that high dignity
Level 2: Nakshatra Dispositor (Mental/Emotional) - See the nakshatra lord (using reversed order for Papa Purusha) - Shows mental attachments, emotional afflictions, what the mind gets stuck on - Uses special reversed nakshatra lordship (Ketu↔︎Buddha, etc.)
Level 3: Conjunction with Planets - If Aprakasha graha is conjoined another planet, that planet gets afflicted - Most important to check: Surya dispositor, Chandra dispositor, and Lagna lord (the three “self points”) - Surya dispositor afflicted → affects progeny, lineage, wealth - Chandra dispositor afflicted → affects body, health, longevity (sharira) - Lagna lord afflicted → affects intelligence, knowledge, brain, fame


Practical Application Steps

Calculate the five Aprakasha grahas
Check if any conjoin the three critical dispositors (Sun, Moon, Lagna)
If yes, note which one and what it afflicts
If not conjoined, see the rashi lord to understand manifestation
Read Parashara’s results for that house placement
Optionally check nakshatra dispositor for mental/emotional dimension



Example: Aishwarya Rai’s Chart

Only Parivesha (afflicts Akasha) was conjoined a planet
It conjoined Buddha (Lagna lord) in 3rd house
Affliction to Lagna = affliction to intelligence/brain
Akasha affliction = things spreading wild, too much importance/fame
Dispositor: Ketu in 10th house (work) + Mars in 8th
Manifestation: Issues with work due to volatile relationship with boyfriend at the time
Parivartana between Buddha and Ketu = eventual resolution



Remedies

Don’t worship Papa Purusha itself
If you find a dosha/curse linked to Aprakasha graha:

Remedy the main issue/curse directly, OR
Do specific Shiva mantra for that Aprakasha graha

Only remedy if it’s causing actual problems in the chart



Important Notes

These are NOT more important than other chart factors - see the chart holistically first
They manifest through their dispositors - they cannot act alone
If dispositor is in high dignity, the affliction is neutralized
Always use reversed nakshatra order for Papa Purusha calculations
